Jasmin.title: Jasmin
Jasmin.address: Product Owner of MAPP at Geolytix
Jasmin.description: Hello, I'm Jasmin. Most people call me 'Jazz'. I'm Product Owner of MAPP at Geolytix. I'm a born and bred East Londonder and still live here today...

Jasmin.title: Epping Forest, Essex
Jasmin.description: Outside of work, you will often find me running. Epping Forest is a frequent stomping ground of mine. If I'm lucky I may spot a deer whilst out on my run. One of my favourite routes takes me to Copped Hall, a Georgian mansion under restoration just outside of the M25

Jasmin.title: London Marathon 2021
Jasmin.description: In October 2021, my dream came true of finally being able to run the London Marathon. I know it's cliché, but there's really nothing like the moment you cross Tower Bridge with hundreds of supporters lined up on either side shouting out your name!

Jasmin.title: Wales May 2021
Jasmin.description: During the pandemic, I enjoyed a few holidays in the UK and embraced the outdoors. In May 2021, I succesfully climbed Mount Sowdon with a group of friends

Jasmin.title: Scotland December 2021
Jasmin.description: And in December 2021, I conquered Conic Hill next to Loch Lomond. I learned that it's much more than just a 'hill'!

Jasmin.title: Rome January 2022
Jasmin.description: I also enjoy travelling further afield when I can. At the start of this year, I visited Rome for the first time with my partner (which I loved). Whilst I was there, I was also able to tick off a new country at the same time (Vatican City). I look forward to many more trips abroad throughout the course of 2022 (and maybe, just maybe another marathon...).

Lou.title: Hi, I'm Lou
Lou.address: Product Owner of Data at Geolytix
Lou.description: I love geography, I'm a keen walker and have a passion for travel. I'm a South Yorkshire lass, originally from Doncaster. I've lived in Sheffield since 2008 when I started studying BSc Geography at Sheffield Hallam University. I continued on to gain my MSc in Geographical Information Systems. In 2013 I joined Geolytix, my role is Product Owner of Data.

Lou.title: Walking
Lou.description:
I absolutely love walking and discovering new routes. Sheffield is the perfect location to live for this hobby, I'm right on the doorstep of the Peak District National Park. Apps like Strava and Sports Tracker are brilliant for tracking exercise. Here are 3 long local walks I loved completeing in the last 2 years and highly recommend:
  • Sheffield Round Walk - 15 miles
  • Edale Skyline, Peak District - 20 miles
  • Don Valley Way, Sheffield-Doncaster - 28 miles

I'm really interested in the Slow Ways initative who are creating a network of walking routes that connect all of Great Britain’s towns and cities.

Lou.title: Gigs & Festivals
Lou.description: I played piano for 8 years when I was younger and although I'm slowly trying to teach myself the ukulele I prefer to leave it to the professionals. My first concert was Spice Girls at Don Valley in 1997. My music taste has evolved and I've been to over 150 gigs. In 2006 I went to my first festival and loved the experience. Since then I have been to Leeds Festival (UK) 5 times, Glastonbury (UK) 3 times, Isle of Wight (UK), Bestival (UK), Secret Garden Party (UK), Benicassim (Spain), Super Bock Super Rock (Portugal).

Lou.title: Travel
Lou.description: I travel as much as I can. One of my favourite trips was in 2018 when myself and my friend & colleague Jazz went to Argentina and Chile. We had a fantastic few days exploring Buenos Aires then flew down to discover Patagonia (both the Argentinian and Chilean sides) followed by a few final days in the beautiful city of Santiago. Buenos Aires > El Calafete > El Chalten > Puerto Natales > Torres Del Paine > Punta Arenas > Santiago

Lou.title: Do the things which scare you
Lou.description: One of the best things I have ever done is hang gliding over Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

Rachel.title: Hey, I'm Rachel!
Rachel.description: I'm a Location Planning Partner at Geolytix and based in the London Office. I'm originally from Maidstone, Kent and called here home for the first 18 years of my life. This is where my love of dance started - a hobby that I'm still passionate about!

Rachel.title: University of Leicester 2014-2017
Rachel.description: Back in 2014 I accepted a place at the Univeristy of Leicester to study BSc Geography. I had the best three years here, exploring the city (I was lucky enough to be in the City when they won the Premier League!!), competing with my dance society in competitions and  going on lots of different field trips (one of the many perks of studing Geography)!

Rachel.title: Inírida, Colombia
Rachel.description: As part of my Degree I was extremely lucky to travel to Colombia and the Amazon basin. Along with studying the ecology and biodiveristy, I also swam with river dolphins, climbed Cerros de Mavecure and ate A LOT of pineapple!

Rachel.title: My spare time
Rachel.description: Outside of work, if I haven't got my nose stuck in a book or I'm not attending an exercise class you'll find me in the kitchen. I absolutely LOVE to bake! The Great British Bake Off is probably a bit out of my reach, but, my friend and I did come second when we went to the 'The Big London Bake'! (Would 100% recommend if you fancy pretending you are in the Bake Off tent!)

Rachel.title: Cyprus
Rachel.description: I have developed a soft spot for Cyprus and it seems to be my go to place for a bit of R&R (I've even sussed out the holiday home I'd love to own!). When I'm on holiday I love to explore nature and wildlife… I've taken to scuba diving and would love to work towards my PADI liscene.

Rachel.title: Iceland 2022
Rachel.description: At the start of this year I took full advantage of travel opening up again and visited Iceland for a few nights. I swam in thermal waters, geeked out over all the geological features and saw the northern lights (twice)!

Coco.title: Hi from China! I am Coco
Coco.description: I was born and grown up in Sichuan, West China, and now living in Guangzhou, the warm and humid South China. I travelled to Shanghai frequently, where Geolytix China office is located. However since 2020 I've been spending most time in Guangzhou - on this island... I've identified the top 3 biggest trees on the island now, which I wouldn't have noticed in the previous years...;-p

Coco.title: CNY Event in London
Coco.address: 1 Kensington Gore, South Kensington, London SW7 2AR
Coco.description: Team, partners, and clients gathering in the Royal Geographical Society. It was the CNY of the year of the dog. We dressed up in Chinese red. Everyone got red packet(s)…

Coco.title: Around our First Office in Shanghai
Coco.description: My first year in Geolytix Shanghai. Lots of new things to learn. All exciting! Still remember the chilly and smelly wind whenever Lifan and I got out from the 'Naked Hub' office during the evenings - there were lots of restaurants around our office, and every evening around 9pm the cleaning men would come to collect the left-over of the day... Therefore smelly:) A nice little pedestrian walk out there, leading you directly to the biggest Starbucks Flaship in the country...

Coco.title: Christmas 2018 in Xiamen
Coco.description: After a sucessful project delivery in Xiamen. Lifan and I went hiking on Gu Lang Yu island to celebrate both the delivery and the Christmas

Coco.title: Team Building in Shanghai
Coco.description: Room Escape. I was the 'victim' in that game, and my colleagues saved me successfully with team efforts. The game was designed as 90 mins, wherease we successfully 'escaped' with less than 60 mins.

Coco.title: Market Visit in Taipei
Coco.description: As the city experts, we make sure we understand the city not just from data and map, but also on feet and with heart.
